plotText.plainText: When the menace known as the Joker wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham, Batman must accept one of the greatest psychological and physical tests of his ability to fight injustice.

caption.plainText: Morgan Freeman, Gary Oldman, Christian Bale, Michael Caine, Aaron Eckhart, Heath Ledger, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Cillian Murphy, and Chin Han in The Dark Knight (2008)

plotText.plainText: Set at the intersection of the near future and the reimagined past, explore a world in which every human appetite can be indulged without consequence.

caption.plainText: Westworld (2016)

plotText.plainText: After a tragic accident, two stage magicians in 1890s London engage in a battle to create the ultimate illusion while sacrificing everything they have to outwit each other.

caption.plainText: Christian Bale, Hugh Jackman, and Scarlett Johansson in The Prestige (2006)

plotText.plainText: In 1990s Pittsburgh, a medicine peddler starts a relationship with a young woman suffering from Parkinson's disease.

caption.plainText: Anne Hathaway and Jake Gyllenhaal in Love & Other Drugs (2010)

plotText.plainText: In 1985 Dallas, electrician and hustler Ron Woodroof works around the system to help AIDS patients get the medication they need after he is diagnosed with the disease.

caption.plainText: Matthew McConaughey in Dallas Buyers Club (2013)

plotText.plainText: A team of explorers travel through a wormhole in space in an attempt to ensure humanity's survival.

caption.plainText: Matthew McConaughey in Interstellar (2014)

plotText.plainText: A young woman who has been in and out of rehab for the past ten years, returns home for the weekend for her sister's wedding.

caption.plainText: Anne Hathaway, Bill Irwin, and Rosemarie DeWitt in Rachel Getting Married (2008)

plotText.plainText: Eight years after the Joker's reign of anarchy, Batman, with the help of the enigmatic Catwoman, is forced from his exile to save Gotham City from the brutal guerrilla terrorist Bane.

caption.plainText: Morgan Freeman, Gary Oldman, Christian Bale, Michael Caine, Matthew Modine, Anne Hathaway, Marion Cotillard, and Joseph Gordon-Levitt in The Dark Knight Rises (2012)

plotText.plainText: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O., but his tragic past may doom the project and his team to disaster.

caption.plainText: Leonardo DiCaprio, Tom Berenger, Michael Caine, Lukas Haas, Marion Cotillard, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Tom Hardy, Elliot Page, Ken Watanabe, and Dileep Rao in Inception (2010)

plotText.plainText: An aspiring author during the civil rights movement of the 1960s decides to write a book detailing the African American maids' point of view on the white families for which they work, and the hardships they go through on a daily basis.

caption.plainText: Viola Davis, Bryce Dallas Howard, Octavia Spencer, and Emma Stone in The Help (2011)

plotText.plainText: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren work to help a family terrorized by a dark presence in their farmhouse.

caption.plainText: The Conjuring (2013)

originalTitleText.text: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 2

plotText.plainText: After the birth of Renesmee/Nessie, the Cullens gather other vampire clans in order to protect the child from a false allegation that puts the family in front of the Volturi.

caption.plainText: Kristen Stewart in The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 2 (2012)

titleText.text: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 2

plotText.plainText: In 19th-century France, Jean Valjean, who for decades has been hunted by the ruthless policeman Javert after breaking parole, agrees to care for a factory worker's daughter. The decision changes their lives forever.

caption.plainText: Isabelle Allen in Les Misérables (2012)

attributes.text: based on: the original stage musical
based on: the original stage musical

plotText.plainText: A little girl lives in a very grown-up world with her mother, who tries to prepare her for it. Her neighbor, the Aviator, introduces the girl to an extraordinary world where anything is possible, the world of the Little Prince.

caption.plainText: Le Petit Prince (2015)

plotText.plainText: A chronicle of the decade-long hunt for al-Qaeda terrorist leader Osama bin Laden after the September 2001 attacks, and his death at the hands of the Navy S.E.A.L.s Team 6 in May 2011.

caption.plainText: Zero Dark Thirty (2012)

plotText.plainText: A male stripper teaches a younger performer how to party, pick up women, and make easy money.

caption.plainText: Magic Mike (2012)

plotText.plainText: Two young boys encounter a fugitive and form a pact to help him evade the vigilantes that are on his trail and to reunite him with his true love.

caption.plainText: Matthew McConaughey in Mud (2012)

plotText.plainText: In New York City 1981, an ambitious immigrant fights to protect his business and family during the most dangerous year in the city's history.

caption.plainText: Albert Brooks, Alessandro Nivola, David Oyelowo, Oscar Isaac, and Jessica Chastain in A Most Violent Year (2014)

plotText.plainText: The true story of Molly Bloom, an Olympic-class skier who ran the world's most exclusive high-stakes poker game and became an FBI target.

caption.plainText: Jessica Chastain in Molly's Game (2017)

plotText.plainText: Armed with only one word, Tenet, and fighting for the survival of the entire world, a Protagonist journeys through a twilight world of international espionage on a mission that will unfold in something beyond real time.

caption.plainText: John David Washington in Tenet (2020)
